alert.note: Alert for Frederick; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 3:28PM EST until January 07 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with isolated totals up to 6 inches. * WHERE...Portions of north central Maryland, the eastern Panhandle of West Virginia, the Shenandoah Valley of Virginia, and portions of northern and central Virginia near the Blue Ridge Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected between 1 AM and 4 AM when snowfall rates of around 1 inch per hour are possible. Visibility will be reduced to near or less than one- half mile snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
